column2: [Root.Location.GetName] is hit by a meteor!
I was in the middle of my business when I was interrupted by a deafening sound. I rush to the nearest window, and the next thing I saw was a blinding flash of fiery light.
WHAT IN THE NAME OF OBLIVION IS THAT -
A Fiery Ball of Death

In all the years of recorded history, there has never been a calamity as terrible as this one. [From.Location.GetName] has been struck by a large, fiery ball of death, a meteor - so large and bright that there are rumors that even the people of Cathay and Nippon witnessed it.

Thousands and thousands are dead, entire settlements have been leveled, fires rage across the land, and a massive dark cloud of ash and smoke cover the region. Those unfortunate enough to survive will have to deal with the unrest and anarchy that follow in the wake of such a disaster, but how can anyone rebuild after this?

There are now some that even say the apocalypse is upon us!
Terrible! May their souls have peace.

[From.Location.GetName] has been the very target of a large meteor impact. The dead are in the tens if not hundreds of thousands, and the destruction is massive. Even after we deal with the influx of refugees and any clean-up attempts, [From.Location.GetName] will suffer for years to come.
How could this happen?
It's certain that many currently in [From.Location.GetName] - some of your courtiers, vassals, family members, and even you yourself - are among the dead or injured.

Although [Root.Location.GetName] wasn't directly hit by the meteor, it did suffer in the aftermath. It's possible that many currently there - some of your courtiers, vassals, family members, and even you yourself - are among the dead or injured.

Before anybody has time to react, there is a huge explosion. You awake moments later in the middle of a large field of rubble, corpses, and raging fires. Unfortunately, it seems you have nasty cuts and wounds, and while it hurts, you quickly realize you were lucky to be alive, or, even better, with all your body parts intact.
You wander aimlessly, hoping to find any other survivors.

Before anybody has time to react, there is a huge explosion. You awake moments later in the middle of a large field of rubble, corpses, and raging fires, feeling great pain. It appears you've been maimed! However, you know in your heart it could've been worse. Thankfully a few other survivors nearby hear your cries and groans, and they help pull you out of the rubble.
You all wander aimlessly, hoping to find any other survivors.
Before anybody has time to react, there is a huge explosion. The last thing you see is a blinding light.
AAAGGGHHHHH!

You saw the fiery ball of destruction as it fell. Just as you and your companions try to comprehend what just happened, a large cloud of smoke and ash appear. You all try to run away as it approaches, but to no avail. In the ensuing chaos, you injure yourself, though when the cloud clears you thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] that it was a simple wound, and nothing worse.
You try to find other survivors.

You saw the fiery ball of destruction as it fell. Just as you and your companions try to comprehend what just happened, a large cloud of smoke and ash appear. You all try to run away as it approaches, but to no avail. In the ensuing chaos, you injure yourself badly. As the cloud clears, you realize due to your injuries you can no longer move properly.
You are helped to your feet by other survivors.

You saw the fiery ball of destruction as it fell. Just as you and your companions try to comprehend what just happened, a large cloud of smoke and ash appear. You all try to run away as it approaches, but to no avail. The last thing you see is the grey soot blowing in your face, and the last thing you feel is an indescribably powerful force slamming into your body.
AAAGGGHHHHH!

Before anybody has time to react, there is a huge explosion. You awake moments later in the middle of a large field of rubble, corpses, and raging fires. Though you have some minor bruises and cuts, and you are temporarily blinded by all the dust, you emerge relatively unscathed.
You later find out you were very lucky, perhaps protected by [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].

You saw the fiery ball of destruction as it fell. Just as you and your companions try to comprehend what just happened, a large cloud of smoke and ash appear. You all try to run away as it approaches, but to no avail. Thankfully you were unharmed as the cloud clears - you're just covered in dust and ash - but others weren't so lucky.
You just know this is going to be a long day...
Some of the other survivors report witnessing a large ball of fire descend from the heavens onto earth. Could this be the end times?
A meteor strikes!
